intro: Metapetrocosmea peltata, commonly known as the broad-leafed rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and produces delicate, often fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or forested areas. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is known for its unique adaptations to its rocky habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
